text: A set of letters published by the famous copywriter Gary Halbert. A fantastic beginners guide to copywriting and business (and life). How to write. How to keep someone’s attention and much more…

text: We've (Almabase) worked with <https://wittypen.com/|Wittypen> a couple of times. Unless the content required is super niche, Wittypen has done a decent job in terms of quality. Quantity - we've never tried out bulk orders so not sure about that. You can choose from the multiple budget options available. We've always gone with the middle tier  which is Rs. 1000-1200/piece.

text:
<!channel>

The <#C02S4318139|jobopps> channel has been a lawless land for long. All of us, including me have posted jobs in any format under the sun.

It's changing right now.

Here's the format that needs to be followed for all job postings in the community:

1. Name of company:

2. Name of role:

3. Years of experience:

3. Current team composition:

4. Location:

5. Answers to the following 3 questions:
5.1 _What do you envision the role will do in the first year?_
_5.2 What will the role be measured on?_
_5.3 What's the annual marketing budget range?_

6. Compensation Range

We are going to be strict about it. s11s is a curated place and we need to ensure quality in every last bit of this wonderful place.

Let people put some efforts to hire the awesome folks here.

elements.text: The

channel has been a lawless land for long. All of us, including me have posted jobs in any format under the sun.

It's changing right now.

Here's the format that needs to be followed for all job postings in the community:

1. Name of company:

2. Name of role:

3. Years of experience:

3. Current team composition:

4. Location:

5. Answers to the following 3 questions:
5.1
What do you envision the role will do in the first year?
5.2 What will the role be measured on?
5.3 What's the annual marketing budget range?

6. Compensation Range

We are going to be strict about it. s11s is a curated place and we need to ensure quality in every last bit of this wonderful place.

Let people put some efforts to hire the awesome folks here.

text: I personally feel that question 5.3 would be sensitive as this is a public forum. Also Salary range can be optional. Rest all looks good.

text: Also, it's 2022. Brands need to be open about their offer. If not, they might as well hire the way they're hiring. I am sure s11s isn't the only place.

text: I slightly disagree. I would really feel to share it with candidate on 1-1 rather than sharing it on forum. It's similar to a candidate looking for opportunity posting their salary expectations. Not everyone will like it.

text: The format is good for large companies but for smaller companies, there are too many moving parts for them to share these exact details. Exposure over experience. Annual budgets fluctuate. Versatility of the candidate.
